CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 The mobility of PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom-gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer. Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. The hole mobility was estimated to be 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , which is 1-2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D-A type low - bandgap photovoltaic polymers ( 2.6 x 10^-4 -3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 5 Although the FET mobility might not be directly correlated to the photovoltaic performance since the situation of the charge transport is quite different from each other , the higher carrier mobility still suggests effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes in the photovoltaic devices. Photovoltaic Properties. The bulk heterojunction PSCs were fabricated with the device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) / LiF / Al. PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate. The film was dried at 150 °C under a N 2 atmosphere for 5 min. After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent. The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode. The effective area ( 2 mm x 3 mm ) of the PSCs was defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light ( Scheme 2 ). PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) in this range. Figure 6 shows the I-V curves of the devices with the best photovoltaic performance under the illumination of AM 1.5 ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The corresponding open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current ( I SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) , and PCE of the devices are also summarized in Figure 3. The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3. Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2. Since the spectral response extends to over 1.1 μm , the spectral mismatch between the simulated and actual AM1.5 spectra must be considered.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) - This is the material used as the channel semiconductor in the field-effect transistor (FET) device.
2. PEDOT:PSS - This is the material used as the electrode in the photovoltaic devices.
3. PCBM - This is the material used as the acceptor in the photovoltaic devices.
4. PC 70 BM - This is another material used as the acceptor in the photovoltaic devices, which has similar electronic properties as PCBM but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region.
5. LiF - This is the material used as the cathode in the photovoltaic devices.
6. Al - This is the material used as the cathode in the photovoltaic devices.
7. ITO - This is the material used as the electrode in the photovoltaic devices.
8. AM 1.5 - This is the simulated solar light used to test the photovoltaic devices.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the given text:

1. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) - This is the material used as the channel semiconductor in the field-effect transistor (FET) device.
2. PCBM - This is the material used as the acceptor in the photovoltaic devices.
3. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM - This is the material used as the channel semiconductor and acceptor in the photovoltaic devices.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| PCBM |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned, along with their property names:

2. Material: ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
Property name: Conductivity
3. Material: PEDOT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
Property name: Conductivity
4. Material: PSS (Poly(styrene sulfonate))
Property name: Conductivity
5. Material: PCBM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) - b - poly(4-vinylphenylene))
Property name: Conductivity
6. Material: PC 70 BM (Poly(4-vinylphenylene) - b - poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
Property name: Conductivity
7. Material: LiF (Lithium Fluoride)
Property name: Conductivity
8. Material: Al (Aluminum)
Property name: Conductivity
9. Material: AM 1.5 (Artificial Solar Light)
Property name: Spectral Irradiance

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of material properties in the paragraph! Here are the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Hole mobility: 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
2. Carrier mobility: 1-2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D-A type low-bandgap photovoltaic polymers (2.6 x 10^-4 - 3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1)
3. PEDOT : PSS spin coating temperature: 150 °C
4. PEDOT : PSS spin coating time: 5 min
5. Solvent used for spin coating PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM mixture: chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene (4 : 1 v/v)
6. LiF / Al evaporation temperature: not mentioned
7. LiF / Al evaporation time: not mentioned
8. Effective area of PSCs: 2 mm x 3 mm
9. Absorption coefficient of PC 70 BM: higher than PCBM in the visible region
10. External quantum efficiency (EQE) of devices under monochromatic light: 30-40% in the range of 450-850 nm
